instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332A: What is 820-3332A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
the device is pulling 0 to 0.89 amps. 0.90 amps continuously repeat after 0 amps
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>  0 volts then 3.4 then zero constant again
cpu is a little hot
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> (l7520 ) 0 volts then 1 then zero constant again

Could it be cpu failure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you test in SMC bypass and safe mode?
Be sure to use 85W Magsafe 2 charger and known good battery.
